fields.description:
h3. Summary
In Epic report, the report will show the message as  "This epic does not contain any issues."
 !Screen Shot 2019-01-25 at 2.45.55 PM.png|thumbnail! 

However, there are child issues for the epic linked to the epic.
 !Screen Shot 2019-01-25 at 3.11.32 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an epic
# Create a child issue for that epic
# Log time
# Go to reports > Epic report

h3. Expected Results
Epic report to show data

h3. Actual Results
Shows message as "This epic does not contain any issues."


h3.Workaround
No workaround
fields.summary: Epic report shows "This epic does not contain any issues." even when there are child issues linked to the epic

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The date indicator line (Today) on the roadmap displays an incorrect date when using a different timezone. It seems like the line is based only on GMT-0.
h3. Environment

Jira Cloud

 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a next-gen project
 # On your roadmap, create a new Epic
 # Configure your timezone in a way that would change the current date from GMT-0.

h3. Expected Results

The "today" date on the roadmap feature would be updated.
h3. Actual Results

The date still the same.
h3. Notes

A practical example:

Let's suppose your current date and time is 21/jan/2019 - 9:00 PM GMT. If you configure your timezone to be GMT+12, your current date and time would be 22/jan/2019 - 9:00 AM, however, the today date of the roadmap feature keeps displaying as you were on 21/Jan/2019.
h3. Workaround

None so far.
fields.summary: Next-gen projects: The date indicator line on the roadmap displays an incorrect date when using a different timezone

fields.description:
Hi Team,

 

In our Jira application, we have a big number of SLA fields. From these SLAs, some of the SLAs are not being used at all, and we need to cleanup/ remove those SLAs,

Though, Jira provides cleaning up SLAs using Administration->Application->Jira Service Desk Configuration ->SLA Names ->Clean up option, the potential downside of this is that the standard SLAs used by eazyBI KPIs might not be actively used by any projects and so they would be removed as well.

We would need a feature to overcome this issue and remove the unused SLAs.

Please let us know if you have any questions.

Thanks!!
fields.summary: Removing unused SLA from JIRA

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When the next-gen project has an elevated amount of Epics three issues happen:
* Epics are not listed while adding a link on an issue
* On _Backlog_, some issues with Epic link won't display the Epic label on the card
* Boards grouped by Epics won't display all issues

h3. Environment
* Jira Software Cloud
* Next-gen project with the _Roadmap_ feature

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a plan with several Epics (tests performed with 100)
 # Add issues to different Epics
 #* Open an issue > click on the *...* button > click on *Add to Epic* > search for random Epic
 #** Some Epics won't be listed
 #* Open the backlog, some issues will show the linked Epic label while on some issues the label will be missing
 #* Group the board by Epic, some issues with an Epic will be missing

h3. Expected Results
* Issues will show the Epic label on _Backlog_
* All Epics will be listed on the dropdown while adding issues to Epic
* All issues are listed on board whether they have an Epic link or not

h3. Actual Results
* Issues don't have the Epic label on _Backlog_
* On the dropdown where we select an Epic to be added to the issue, some Epics are not available
* Some issues won't be displayed on board when grouping by Epic

h3. Notes
The 'Add to Epic' issue is intermittent, not occurring to specific Epics.

h3. Workaround
fields.summary: Some Epics are missing while selecting an Epic to add on a story

fields.description:
It should be possible to setup visual elements in Board, such as:
 * Switch for showing/hiding labels, or just showing colour of labels as in Trello
 * Switch for showing/hiding task's key
 * Possibility to extend column's width and cell's width so as a result more cells can fit into 1 screen
fields.summary: Board - Visuals

fields.description:
h3. Summary

When migrating from a Next-gen Project to a Classic SCRUM Project, the report history is lost thus all related reports are blank (Burnup report, Velocity report).

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Have a Next-gen Project where 1 or more Sprint occurred and completed
# Migrate (bulk move) from Next-gen to Classic SCRUM as described in [Migrate between Next-gen/Classic|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/migrate-from-an-agility-project-to-a-classic-project-957974933.html]

h3. Expected Results

Issues migrated along with reporting history in the concerned reports.

h3. Actual Results

Report history lost. Example below is from a Velocity report.
 !Velocity_report.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Workaround

There is no workaround at this moment. A possible solution to this would be to have a built-in migration tool such as JSWCLOUD-17441 where this data can be carried.
fields.summary: Report data lost when migrating to Classic a project

fields.description:
So automatic report not worked i try it so:

It would be very convenient for a more automated process if you could also trigger actions when a field takes a certain value. E.g. The assigned person.

The problem is that we have e.g. created an AutoAssign process but the Jira Assign still exists. Only with Assign no status is changed.
fields.summary: Field Changed Trigger

fields.description:
The Next-Gen projects do not know the concept of "workflows" as we do know from the classis projects (yet?). So anything regarding postactions and triggers is not available on these projects. 

!image-2019-01-24-09-48-50-104.png! It would be nice if we somehow could add "workflow" triggers to Next-Gen projects. Perhaps this could be achieved by creating so called "Rules" that allow us to transition issues based on certain GIT events (e.g. Pull request created / declined). !image-2019-01-24-09-49-50-068.png! "Rules"
fields.summary: Add git (workflow) triggers

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, versions are sorted according to the sequence they are added. This sequence can be updated by dragging and dropping versions on the Release page. However, this update needs to performed on each project, for each version.

h3. Suggested Solution
On Release page there's the option to sort by other components but that setting is not permanent. An ideal solution would be making that sort configuration permanent.

h3. Why this is important
If there are too many versions on a project, dragging and dropping them would be time consuming. Also, having the versions sorted by name turns the process of filling _Fix version_ (and _Affected version_) field easier for the users.
fields.summary: Sort releases by name or start date

Best regards

dcube

!Screen Shot 2019-01-21 at 18.28.23.png|width=322,height=201!

fields.description:
Currently, the Roadmap feature filter epics by status categories: "To Do", "In Progress", and "Done".

As a user, I want to filter epics in Roadmap based on the statuses/board's column names instead of status categories. Filter by statuses is more intuitive.
fields.summary: As a user, I want the Roadmap filter based on status/columns

fields.description:
h3. Suggestion

Currently, Roadmaps has only 3 filters, done/ todo/ progress. It's too small. I have some Epic which should be managed differently in one project. Hence I can't filter them on the Roadmap I am considering the separation of the project. If you add some filters on the Roadmap, it will be really helpful.
 * it would be extremely useful if project administrators could add custom filters based on fields available in tickets belonging to the board.
 * In addition to this, it would be helpful to have filter options by Category, project lead, period and issue number

----
{quote}
h4. *+Update from Jira Roadmaps team - December 2021+*

Hi all - Thank you for your valued feedback and for describing the needs/use cases of your teams. We are considering the implementation of more filters, and it is on our roadmap for the next 6 months. 
Please add any more use cases or requests for filters to this ticket. We are reviewing the feedback to help prioritize.

If you feel like you have a specific need or would like to give general feedback about Jira roadmaps, you can book some time with me here:[https://calendly.com/ratheshr/planning-convo] - I’d love to have a conversation where we can dive into the specifics.
{quote}
fields.summary: More Filter for Roadmaps

fields.description:
At this moment, resolved issues in a next-gen project (rightmost column on the board) are removed from the board 14 days after the latest update. This means that if an issue is resolved (moved to rightmost column) 16 days ago, but a small change was made to it today, like a user started watching, ranking was changed etc this issue will stay on the board for 14 more days.

Please filter the issues in the rightmost column so that the 14 days are counted since the moment the issue was resolved and not since the last update.
fields.summary: hide issues from board at 14 days since their resolution

fields.description:
The ellipsis button to "View Summary of Assigned Work" on an Agile board is effectively useless if a task has rolled-over from one sprint to the next.


For example, let's say I have a 2 week sprint, and I assign two one-week-duration tasks to developer Fred, Task 1 and Task 2.

If Fred does not complete Task 2, he might have 1 day remaining, and we roll the task over to the next sprint.

The View Summary of Assigned Work says Fred has 1 week of work assigned (based on Original Time Estimate) which is clearly wrong.

I then have to compute the summary times using a spreadsheet, which defeats the whole point of JIRA. My only other alternative is to close the task and issue a continuation task.
fields.summary: View Summary of Assigned Work should permit Remaining Time as an option

fields.description:

fields.description:
*Problem Definition*
 Currently, when using this URL {{[https://your-domain.atlassian.net/rest/api/3/status/]}} while logged in to list all the different Statusus configured on a Jira Cloud Instance, it only returns the Statusus and Status ID of Projects associated to "Classic Project" where that of the next-gen project is not visible. So if implementing a use case of the REST API endpoint that retrieves user's ticket with their specific Status id, it becomes difficult to know which id is associated to next-gen project.

*Suggested Solution*
 Include the next-gen status id as well to the [*Status search API endpoint*|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/platform/rest/v3/?utm_source=%2Fcloud%2Fjira%2Fplatform%2Frest%2F&utm_medium=302#api-api-3-status-idOrName-get] so it is displayed when searched.

*Why this is important*
 As the next-gen project is a future agile project management tool, it would be good if development options to work with the next-gen project are easily available.

*Workaround*
 Use the Status URL search {{[https://your-domain.atlassian.net/rest/api/3/status/]}} while logged in your Jira Cloud Instance to list all the Status id, see the last id of the status listed, then perform a *JQL search* via the *UI in Issue navigator search* of the next number after the last id seen to determine which status id belongs to that of next-gen project. *Example* if the last Status id is *10039*, perform a search via the UI for *10040* until you determine which Status falls under next-gen projects as the issues will be listed.
 !issueview-search.png|width=535,height=190!
fields.summary: Ability to Show the Status Id of next-gen project via REST API endpoint

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The drag and drop feature in Jira does not work when the length of the destination is beyond the screen.

h3. Environment
Jira cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Go to a project and select 'Releases'
# Select to display 'Released', 'Unreleased' and 'Archived' versions (all statuses)
# Attempt to drag one of the top 17 versions to a location below the top 17th (The drop should be off-screen).

h3. Expected Results
The version is correctly placed into the new location
 !Screenshot_707.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
Releasing the version below this point will cause the version to jump back to its original location
 !Screenshot_706.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Release drag and drop does not work beyond visible screen length

fields.description:
When copying a default workflow, the description should be automatically made blank instead of copying the description of the source workflow. 

The reason for this is because when copying a Jira created workflow, the description contains instructions which can be confusing when place in a copied workflow.
fields.summary: Remove default description when copying a workflow.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, users are allowed to reorder Sprint which is specifically not started. The re-ordering can be done from the Backlog page. When the Sprint is started, the option to re-order will automatically be removed from the Sprint.


h3. Suggested Solution

Allow the Active Sprint to be re-ordered similar to the Sprint which is not started.


h3. Workaround 

None
fields.summary: Allow reordering Active Sprint

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If a Jira Software user has a Jira Service Desk inactive account (JSD customer) using the same email address, the smart commits do not for this user.

h3. Environment

* Jira Software cloud
* Jira Service Desk cloud
* Jira and Bitbucket integration

h3. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a Jira Software project and a Jira Service Desk project
# Integrate Jira and Bitbucket (both cloud)
# Add a Jira Software user as a Jira Service Desk customer (both using the same email address)
# Deactivate this customer
# Perform a commit in Bitbucket using the [smart commits syntax|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucket/use-smart-commits-298979931.html]

h3. Expected Results

The smart commit creates an action (comment, log work, or transition) the issue mentioned in the commit 

h3. Actual Results

The action of the smart commit does not work

h3. Notes

h3. Workaround

Delete the inactive Jira Service Desk customer using the same email address of the affected user
fields.summary: Smart commits do not work if a Jira Software user has an inactive Jira Service Desk user using the same email address

fields.description:
In the _view issue_ screen of a Jira issue, the order in which the completed sprints (that this issue has been part of) appear seems to be random.

I would like to see the completed sprints ordered by their _completed date_ descending
fields.summary: order 'completed sprints' by end date

fields.description:
There are several instances where a task link opens a modal, and some where a new window/tab is opened. It would be fantastic if there was a way to easy figure out which will do what, or the ability to configure this action.

 

Opening a modal on top of a modal is a bad practice, but reloading the content within a modal is fine (AFAIK) . So, I think there should be some kind of indicator, or some way to configure what links will do what so that we don't accidentally enter a new page when we expected a modal, etc.
fields.summary: As a Jira user, I would like to know which items will open a window and which a modal

JIRA timelogging before:
w 5 m Enter
JIRA timelogging now:
w w Backspace Tab Tab Tab Tab 5 m Tab Tab Tab Enter F5 (because now we're stuck)
 
This is awesome...

fields.description:
Hello,

I've got a suggestion to make concerning the roadmap. I really like how it depicts all epics together, but what is missing are the other issues. Where can you see all issues of a specific epic in a roadmap? Nowhere, so here's my suggestion:

 

When you click on an epic in your roadmap, the epics' overview opens on the right side of your screen. But why not split up or kind of open up the epic into its issues? It can still be possible to see the issues on the right side of the screen, but in my opinion that feature would really add to the roadmap - which I really enjoy working with, by the way. It would just make it look a bit more clear and it would be possible to have an overview of your whole epic, not just the epic itself.

 

I would love to show what I mean by attaching a picture, but unfortunately I don't know how and if that is even possible.

 

Kind Regards

 

Sabrina Holzer
fields.summary: Roadmap for Epics and Issues

fields.description:
We would like to submit a feature request for an enhancement to the Slack x Jira integration. We are interested in being able to use Slack as a way to communicate with people about updates to Jira tickets, such as new comments. Here is what we would like as a part of that:
 
- The ability to receive these updates as direct messages rather than in a channel. Our email addresses are the same across both systems, so that could be a parameter to match on.
 
- The ability for the end-user to then respond to the comment from Slack and have it push back to the Jira ticket

fields.description:
{noformat:title=Atlassian status as of March 2021}
Hello all,

Thank you for watching, voting, and commenting on this issue.
 
We use this data as well as many other inputs to feed into our prioritization process. Resolution field will be available in next-gen in the future; however, this is not something that will be focusing on in the next year. We want to share this with you to ensure you can plan out your use of projects within Jira Software effectively.

In the short term, we shipped the ability to add multiple Done statuses and map multiple statuses to a single column.


Please continue to vote and in particular please continue to add comments on how your teams find value in the resolution field. This contextual information of what you are doing and why you are doing is invaluable for us in providing you with a product that will grow with your needs.

Thank you,
Bryan Lim
Product Manager
{noformat}
h3.  

Problem definition

Currently, when transitioning an issue to right-most column of a board, it set's the *Done* resolution.
h3. Suggested Solution

Add the ability to customize which Resolution is going to be set by Board Rules or drop-down list with the options, for example, *Won't Do* or *Duplicate*, or removing the resolution flag altogether.
fields.summary: Customize Resolution field in team-managed projects

fields.description:
h3. Update on 18th May 2020

 Hi Everyone, 

We would like to inform you that our developers are currently working on enabling Project Lead and Default Assignee for next-gen projects on JSW/JSD. While we cannot provide you with exact timelines at this point, we expect this work to be completed soon. 

We understand how this issue limits the usability of next-gen projects, and we are working to make this feature available to customers ASAP. Kindly expect another update in this regard from us next week. 

Thank you,
Arjoon Som
Sr. Product Manager
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, it is not possible to configure default assignee for the next-gen projects.
h3. Suggested Solution

Please allow configuring default assignee in next-gen projects
h3. Why this is important

Currently, the feature of setting a default assignee is not available customer would like have to the ability have this option.
fields.summary: Ability to add a default assignee in next-gen project

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian status as of 9 Mar 2021|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#b2d4ff|titleBGColor=#b2d4ff|bgColor=#eaf1fc}
We shipped this today! Let me know if you have any questions or concerns.

Thank you,
 Bryan Lim
 Product Manager
{panel}
h3.  Problem definition

Status categories in next-gen projects will follow the columns' orders in the board. For example, the left-most column or status in the board will be using "To Do" category, the right-most column/status of the board will be using "Done" category and other columns/statuses will be utilizing the "In Progress" category.

Currently it's not possible to customize these categories, for example to set the category of multiple statuses/columns to "Done".
h3. Suggested resolution

Provide the ability to customize the category of statuses in next-gen projects.
fields.summary: Multiple done statuses (with multiple columns) and the ability to map multiple statuses to one column on the board

fields.description:
As an admin, I've created custom fields which I expected to be able to report off of. 
By using the basic search, users are unable to search for issues using a custom field.

As a workaround, users must change to advanced search and use the JQL to search for those issues.

It would be great if we could use the basic search for that.
fields.summary: As a user, I'd like to be able to use Next-Gen custom field form the basic search

On a Browser when viewing issues on Board and the tab is pinned, it causes a continuous loading spinner on the old issue view, which doesn't stop to load.

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 21 April 2020}
Hi everyone,

I am Ritesh Ranjan, Product Manager for Jira. We have been working hard to improve the way you manage projects in Jira. Your comments and feedback has been useful in shaping these features.

Today I want to share a quick update on Project Archiving. We have been working on Project Archiving over the past few months, and at this point we are testing the feature. Post testing completion, we will be launching this feature in a gradual rollout to all Jira Software Premium customers. We also announced this feature in Summit 2020.

On a related note, we are also releasing “Trash” for Projects, which moves projects to trash bin before it gets permanently deleted. You can follow progress of that ticket at https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-23498.

Thanks,
Ritesh Ranjan
Product Manager, JIRA Platform
{panel}
 

In next-gen Jira project, there is no option for hiding or archiving projects. It would be great to be able to archive a project that's no longer in use and refer to them in the future.

Also, as a next-gen user I want these archived projects available for viewing for the whole team but through a separate "archived" section.
fields.summary: Next-gen archive/hide projects

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Unable to add issues to sprint on Next-gen projects. This happens to instances that previously had turned on Sprint featured, but then turned it off again. An upgrade task ran on their instance, and then they turned Sprints back on.
h3. Environment
 * Jira Software Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce

n/a
h3. Expected Results

All issues are added to the sprint.
h3. Actual Results

Issues reverting back to the backlog after a page refresh.
h3. Notes

 
h3. Workaround
 # Go to the Project Settings >  Issue types and find the affected issue type.
 # Change the order of any 2 fields and click Save.
 # Revert the ordering and click Save.
fields.summary: Unable to add issues to sprint on Next-gen projects

fields.description: Would be great if one can create not one but more boards in next-gen projects, and put then on one roadmap in it.
fields.summary: Ability to create multiple boards in next-gen projects

fields.description:
h3. Summary
I have been evaluating with the Jira Software Build API, created an app with the {{jiraBuildInfoProvider}} module and write scope. Installation works as expected. However, when I try to make a request to {{POST /rest/builds/0.1/bulk}} I keep getting 404. Unfortunately, 404 is not documented as an error to expect from the service. 
 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create an app with {{jiraBuildInfoProvider}} module
# Call [Submit build data|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/jira/software/rest/#api-group-Builds]

h3. Expected Results
Status 200

h3. Actual Results
HTTP Status 404
fields.summary: Jira Software Build API is returning HTTP status 404

fields.description:

fields.summary: Add multiple assignee

fields.description:
As a user working with a Next-gen project I would like the ability to add existing custom fields to the a project. 

 

My company uses Tempo for our time tracking and we have invested some time in integrating tempo accounts with our CRM to keep an up to date list of possible client's to track time against. We would like to use the new next-gen projects but we are unable to add existing custom fields so although the tempo plug in works to log work we can't associate that work with a specific client.

 

This would also be useful for other fields which are common to many of our development teams. For instance we have dropdowns for other business units that need to review our work that should be consistent across projects. Maintaining these separately in the current next-gen projects is onerous.
fields.summary: Add existing custom fields to next-gen projects

fields.description: Currently the sprints can have a name that is up to 30 characters. It would be useful to increase that, to 60 or 70 characters. The column "NAME" in the "AO_60DB71_SPRINT" table in database is type character varying(255), so that restriction in only in the UI, not in the database, which would make the changes easier to implement.
fields.summary: Ability to set sprint names longer than 30 characters

fields.description:
*Issue Summary*

Setting 'jira.issue.actions.order' to 'desc' not working on New JIRA Issue View
h3. Environment

Jira Cloud
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Enable *New Jira issue view for software projects* in Profile Settings
 # Set *Advanced Settings > jira.issue.actions.order* to *desc*
 # Comments on tickets sorted oldest > newest, i.e ascending order
 # Set *Advanced Settings > jira.issue.actions.order* to *asc*
 # Comments on tickets sorted oldest > newest, i.e ascending order.


 # Disable *New Jira issue view for software projects* in Profile Settings
 # Set *Advanced Settings > jira.issue.actions.order* to *desc*
 # Comments on tickets sorted newest > oldest, i.e descending order
 # Set *Advanced Settings > jira.issue.actions.order* to *asc*
 # Comments on tickets sorted oldest > newest, i.e ascending order

h3. Expected Results

When setting *Advanced Settings > jira.issue.actions.order* to *desc,* comments on tickets should be sorted newest > oldest, i.e descending order
h3. Actual Results

Comments order remains in ascending order (oldest > newest)

 
h3. Workaround

Disable New Issue View
fields.summary: Setting 'jira.issue.actions.order' to 'desc' not working on New JIRA Issue View

fields.description:
h3. Unable to use the browser search function to search on Jira board



h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Search for an existing issue in your backlog using the browser search functionality(Command + F). The browser will search for the issue and highlight the issue
 !Screen Shot 2019-01-09 at 6.04.12 PM.png|thumbnail! 
# If you perform the same search from the board tab the browser does not search for the issue.
 !Screen Shot 2019-01-09 at 6.07.25 PM.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results

The browser should highlight the issue since the issue is present in the board

h3. Actual Results
The browser does not search for the particular issue.

h3. Notes
* While performing the search the browser identifies the issue till the project key. Once the issue id is entered the search does not recognise the particular issue
* Was able to replicate in firefox and chrome


h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behaviour. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Unable to use the browser search functionality to search on Jira board

fields.description:
h2. Summary
It is not possible to delete phantom sprints that appear when selecting sprints. These sprints are sometimes no longer needed and a user should be able to delete them like regular sprints.

h2. How to reproduce
# Create a software project A
# Create  a sprint in project A
# Create Project B
# Delete project A
# Now create an issue and try to link a sprint to it.
 
h3. Expected behavior
Only available sprints should appear on the list 

h3. Actual results
Sprints from the deleted project appear as future sprints.

h2. Workaround
Currently none
fields.summary: Cant remove phantom sprint
As a Jira Software user, I want to be able to see the Epic information from next-gen projects in the search view

fields.description:
h2. Issue

Currently the Epic card list has a section "Issues in Epic" but the sorting of those issues cannot be sorted by status or resolution or assignee.

Sorting would be helpful to quickly get an overview of the Epic. So I like to do this with as few mouse clicks as possible.
fields.summary: Add a link from the View Issue page of an Epic which shows the "Issues in Epic" in Issue Navigator

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When using a lower resolution display (like 1366*768), the *Start Sprint* button gets hidden at the bottom of the page and is not reachable to be clicked
h3. Environment
Jira Cloud. Chrome or Firefox

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Set the resolution to 1366*768 or lower
 # From the Backlog section of a board, click *Start sprint*.
 # Notice that the pop-up that appears has a scroll bar, but the *Start* button at the bottom is not included in the scrolled content. Also, the overall page does not have a scroll bar.

h3. Expected Results
Either the whole page should have a scroll bar, or the *Start* button should be scrolled in the pop-up
h3. Actual Results
The *Start* button cannot be clicked because it's hidden at the bottom

h3. Notes
The screenshot attached is of the whole screen

h3. Workaround
The only workaround is to use the _Zoom Out_ functionality of the browser (Ctrl - on Windows or CMD - on Mac) to make the button appear on the screen
fields.summary: The Start Sprint button is hidden at the bottom on a lower resolution display

fields.description:

Opening an image that was attached to the ticket via a JSD email handler will result in the error: "Ouch! We can't preview this file type".

h3. Environment

Jira Service Desk.
Jira Software.
New Issue View.

# Create a Service Desk Project
# Create a Kanban board to display issues from the JSD project.
# Create an issue view email with an image attached.
# Go to the Kanban board, open the ticket card and then try to preview the image.

h3. Expected Results

The image is successfully previewed.

h3. Actual Results

The following error occurs.

 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

h3.Workaround

Open the ticket in a new tab in order to preview the attachment.

fields.description:

Provide a rolled-up version of Sprint Report

In Jira Software, the reports do not consider the sub-tasks, only the parent issue (story or task).

Subtasks information should also be considered on all Jira reports

h3. Workaround 
There's no workaround at the moment

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Currently, it is only possible to move an issue from the backlog to the board (and vice-versa) dragging-and-dropping the issue on the backlog view.

Allow users to move an issue from the backlog to the board (and vice-versa) from the issue view, under the button "More" (...)
Also, allows selecting whether or not to move an issue from the backlog to the board by changing the issue status.

h3. Workaround

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Agile board is trying to change font size when user is executing different actions. Font size change back and forth makes it look as if board is "jumping".

 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a kanban board with more than 5 columns
 # Create several swimlanes
 # Create several issues to fill up the board
 # Try to execute different actions: 
- drag issue from column to column
- move issue
- rename issue
- change status
- refresh board clicking on "refresh" notification
- switch browser tab, go back to board and try to scroll without performing any particular actions

h3. Expected Results

At some point while executing different actions, board starts to change font size back and forth.
h3. Actual Results

Board should not change font size back and forth.

Example of the board "jumping":
 [^Board_jumping_1.mov]
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: Operating with board makes it change font size back and forth

Next-gen backlog and board use Russian language.

!image-2018-12-27-17-29-12-148.png!

!image-2018-12-27-17-23-44-298.png!

None at this moment.

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Customers would like the ability to convert an already established Independent Project (next-gen) to a Full Jira Software Project, and vice-versa

h3. Suggested Solution
Include an option that converts the Independent Project to a Regular Jira Software Project

h3. Why this is important
Customers may have started an Independent Project (next-gen) but as some functionality is not currently available (Estimation), they would need a way to change the Project Type so they could add Estimates/Time Tracking
 
h3. Workaround 
Create a New Project and Move the Issues from the Independent Project (next-gen) to the New

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian status as of February 2021|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#b2d4ff|titleBGColor=#b2d4ff|bgColor=#eaf1fc}
Hello all,

Thank you for watching, voting, and commenting on this issue.

We use this data as well as many other inputs to feed into our prioritisation process. Being able to add labels to the cards in the Backlog view will be something that will be available in next-gen, although it is not something that we will be focusing on in the next year. We want to share this with you to ensure you can plan out your use of projects within Jira Software effectively.

In the short term we recommend teams use classic projects if this is an absolute must for you. We apologise for the inconvenience this may cause you. 

Please continue to vote and in particular please continue to add comments on how your team would find value when having labels on the cards in the Backlog. This contextual information of what you are doing and why you are doing is invaluable for us in providing you with a product that will grow with your needs.

Thank you,
Eoin Ryan
Product Manager
{panel}



As an project admin, I would like to be able customized which labels are visible in the backlog view and on the card on the board, so I don't have to misuse epics

 

In the "old" Jira it was possible to customize cards ([https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/customizing-cards-764478020.html]). This feature is missing in the next gen projects, please add it!
fields.summary: Customize visibility of labels in the Backlog view of team-managed projects

{panel:title=Atlassian status as of February 2021|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#b2d4ff|titleBGColor=#b2d4ff|bgColor=#eaf1fc}
Hello all,

Thank you for watching, voting, and commenting on this issue.

We use this data as well as many other inputs to feed into our prioritisation process. Having issues from other projects on a team-managed project/board will be something that will be available in team-managed projects, although it is not something that we will be focusing on in the next year. We want to share this with you to ensure you can plan out your use of projects within Jira Software effectively.

In the short term we recommend teams use company-managed projects when you need to include issues from multiple projects on a board. We apologise for the inconvenience this may cause you.

Please continue to vote and in particular please continue to add comments on how your teams find value when including issues from multiple projects on a board. This contextual information of what you are doing and why you are doing is invaluable for us in providing you with a product that will grow with your needs.

Thank you,
 Ivan Teong
 Product Manager

fields.description:
h3.*Problem Definition*
At the moment, using the bulk change feature to move issues to team-managed (formerly next-gen) project. When a similar custom field with the same name exist on the Issue type custom field there's a prompt for data update. Likewise, if the field doesn't exist, there will be no prompt for data update.
In the above scenarios the data on those fields are removed and needs to be added manually. If the fields exist (In the team-managed (formerly next-gen) project), the data is still removed and still needs to be entered manually. However these fields data are actually hidden, by using the search button view all issues and select the columns to add the field name, the data is still there but if altered prior to the move, then the data changes.
 !fields.png|thumbnail! 


h3.*Suggested Solution*
Add a feature that will automatically detect that those fields do not exist and prompt the user for a decision. If the fields that match exist, automatically match the fields to the team-managed (formerly next-gen) project retaining the data.

h3.*Why this is important*
As the team-managed (formerly next-gen) project provides a Roadmap functionality, which tells a much larger part in Agile Project. it would be better if projects can be migrated successfully than going through the daunting task to re-creating projects from scratch and custom fields which is inefficient.

h3.*Workaround*
To manually create a similar custom fields following the [*available custom fields in team-managed projects*|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftwarecloud/available-custom-fields-for-next-gen-projects-957511207.html] that mimics the same fields / have the same name on company-managed (formerly classic) project and manually update the data all over again on the team-managed (formerly next-gen) project or during the move. [last resort]
fields.summary: Fields or Custom field's values are removed during bulk change to team-managed (formerly next-gen) project
